metadata.title: CVE-2010-0305 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
ejabberd_c2s.erl in ejabberd before 2.1.3 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (daemon crash) via a large number of c2s (akaclient2server) messages that trigger a queue overload.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-0305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ejabberd - 18.01-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ejabberd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.01-2').
